## Current Positions in the Lab

### [Post Doctoral Researcher in Single Cell Bioinformatics](https://universityvacancies.com/university-limerick/post-doctoral-researcher-single-cell-bioinformatics-fixed-term-contract)

We are seeking a postdoctoral fellow to develop algorithms and methods for scRNAseq, multi-omics, and spatial single-cell data analysis. The deadline for applications is **February 28th**. Informal inquiries are welcome. For more information, please see the [Contact Information](#contact-information) below.

---

## Graduate Students

We welcome emails from candidates interested in undertaking a **3-year, 4-year, full or part-time, in-person or hybrid PhD** in the lab.

Prospective students should have:

- A keen desire to pursue computational oncology research.
- A master's degree, professional experience, or a distinguished undergraduate degree.
- Experience in programming (R, Python, etc.).

Please title your email **"Seeking Computational Oncology PhD"** and include:

- Your CV or resume.
- A link to your GitHub account (or similar).
- A cover letter (max 1 page) describing your research interests.

---

## Other Positions

We will be advertising PhD, Postdoc, and Research Assistant positions to work on the **eHealth** and **GDI** projects. Please [contact us](#contact-information) to learn more.

---

## Values & Code of Conduct

We value **scientific rigor and reproducibility** and support an open approach to science that promotes the sharing of ideas, code, and expertise.

We value **diversity and inclusion** and work to provide a kind, welcoming, collaborative environment that is free of harassment. Our code of conduct is modeled on the [Bioconductor Code of Conduct](https://www.bioconductor.org/about/code-of-conduct/).
